Sequence Information.Peptide Name: [G4a]-SHa (NST-2, Synthetic AMPs, D-alanine variant of Temporin-SHa , XXD, XXA, UCLL1c)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution, amphibians, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is unique and shows only very low similarity (92.31%) toTemporin-SHaL:23%, G=F: 15%.Chemical modification:  A4 is a D-amino acid. C-terminal amidation.Activity: active against Gram+ S. aureus NCTC 13277 MRSA (MIC 14.34 uM), B. subtilis ATCC 23857 (MIC 6.25 uM), Gram- S.typhi ATCC 14028 (MIC 250 uM), E.coli ATCC 25922 (MIC 125 uM), P.aeruginosa ATCC 10145 (MIC >250 uM), and fungi C. albicans ATCC 36082 (MIC 20 uM).Structure:  helical in 20 mM SDS.In vitro toxicity: human RBC: HC50 90 uM. Breast cancer cells MCF-7 (IC50 17.9 uM), cervical cancer Hela cells (IC50 >100 uM).
Literature Information.Author: Nazir S, Khan AI, Maharjan R, Khan SN, Akram MA, Maresca M, Khan FA, Shaheen F. 2024
Literature Information.Title: Synthesis of Temporin-SHa Retro Analogs with Lysine Addition/Substitution and Antibiotic Conjugation to Enhance Antibacterial, Antifungal, and Anticancer Activities.
